_comment: Hacker News source - currently disabled due to low content volume
_reason: Research showed HN has insufficient Vue/Nuxt content for weekly newsletters. Over 60 days, only 1-3 relevant stories are found. Most weeks return 0 results. See research notes below.
_howToEnable: Copy the configuration below and add it to sources.json array

_recommendations.query: Use 'vuejs' instead of 'vue' to avoid false positives like 'review', 'revenue', 'interview'
_recommendations.minScore: Use 5 instead of 20 - most Vue content gets 1-5 points, 20+ is extremely rare
_recommendations.timeWindow: The adapter uses 7 days by default. Consider extending to 30-60 days for HN
_recommendations.priority: Set to 2 (low priority) since content is unreliable

_researchFindings.volumePerWeek: 0-1 stories with 20+ points, 1-2 stories with 5+ points
_researchFindings.scoreDistribution: 80% have 1-3 points, 15% have 5-10 points, only 1% have 20+ points
_researchFindings.comparedToOtherSources: Dev.to: 20-50+ weekly, Reddit: 10-30+ weekly, HN: 0-1 weekly

option1_conservative._description: Most conservative - only highly upvoted Vue stories from last 60 days
option1_conservative._note: Adapter will automatically use 'vue OR nuxt OR vite' query with 7-day filter. Expect 0 results most weeks.

option2_recommended._description: Recommended if re-enabling - lower score threshold, accepts more content
option2_recommended._note: Using explicit URL to override default query. Uses 'vuejs' for better precision. Still expect 1-2 results per month at best.

option3_vite_focused._description: Focus on Vite instead - better volume than Vue/Nuxt on HN
option3_vite_focused._note: Vite content has better HN engagement than Vue. Expect 1-2 relevant results per week.

_instructions: To re-enable: Choose one configuration from 'configurations' above, copy it (without the '_description' and '_note' fields), and add it to the sources.json array.
